page.title: 04THE JEWISH SABBATH 2
page.content:
candles, two loaves of bread and wine in a beautiful goblet. Father makes a blessing, the kiddish, whilst the rest of the family stands. After father has said Kiddish, the whole family wash their hands after which no one is allowed to talk. Father then makes a blessing over the bread, which is called "Challa". The challa is three lengths of dough plaited together to make a tasty soft bread. After the blessing everyone takes a bite out of the bread and then they are allowed to talk.
The meal may consist of traditional chicken soup. During dinner the family sing and speak words from the law. When dinner is finished God is thanked for the meal.
